duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide and coordinate care for critically ill patients
Collaborate with physicians and multidisciplinary team members to provide physical and psychological support to patients and their families
Administer prescribed medications, change dressings, clean wounds, and monitor vital signs
Serve as the primary coordinator of all disciplines for well-coordinated patient care
Monitor, record, and communicate patient condition utilizing computerized documentation systems
Assess and coordinate patient's discharge planning needs with healthcare team

education_certification.credential: RN licensure by Tennessee Board of Nursing or a Board of Nursing from a compact state. Associate's degree; Bachelor’s degree is preferred, BLS required, ACLS must be obtained within 6 Months of hire or transfer from non-ICU area
